definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: take (NH id., esp. buy, and (Niph.) be taken in marriage; MI:17, MI:20 Impf. [[ואקח]]; Ph. [[לקח]]; As. liḳû, laḳû Dl:HWB 384; Ar. laqih.a conceive (of female), IV. impregnate; Eth. laqh.a: receive; Zinj. [[לקח]] DHM:Sendsch. 59; Aram. also Inscr. of Carpentr.:3 (Imv. [[קחי]]); cf. Cook:Gloss Aram. Inscr);—

take, take in the hand, sq. acc. rei, Ex 7:15 (J), Ex 17:5 (E), Nu 25:7 (P), 2Ki 4:29 (all c. [[בְּיַד]]) 2Sa 18:14 (c. [[בְּכַף]]), cf. Ge 8:9 (J), Ex 4:17, Ex 12:22 (JE), De 15:17 + oft.; Ge 40:11 (E; of plucking grapes. 2Sa 4:6 read [[סׂקְלָה]]for [[לֽקְחֵי]], v. [[חִטָּה]], p. 334 supra, and [[סקל]]). This easily passes into

take and carry along with oneself, [[כֶּסֶף קְחוּ בְיֶדְכֶם]] Ge 43:12 (J), Jos 9:11 (JE), 1Ki 14:3, 2Ki 5:5, 2Ki 8:8, 2Ki 8:9, 2Ki 9:1 all Pr 7:20 (all c. [[בְּיַד]]); Ge 43:15, Jos 9:4 (both JE), +.

definitions.title: 3. a.
definitions.body: take from, or out of, sq. act. rei vel pers., + [[מִן]] loc.: Ge 2:22 (rib from man), Ge 3:22 (man from ground; both J) ; De 19:12, 1Sa 17:49, 1Ki 17:19 +; [[וַיִּקַּ ח אֶת־הַחֶרֶב מֵעַל]] [[יֶרֶךְ יִמִינוֹ]] Ju Jdg 3:21 (i.e. drew it); c. [[ב]] instr. [[בְּמֶלְקָחַיִם]] [[מֵעַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ]] ´[[ל]] Is 6:6; sq. [[מִן]] partit. 2Sa 12:4.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: take, carry away: Ez Eze 3:14 sprit lifited me up and carried me away; fig.of passion carrying one away Job 15:12.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: take away from, so as to deprive of, sq. acc. Ge 42:36 (E); sq. acc.+ [[מִן]], Ge 44:29 ([[מֵעִם]]; J), 1Ki 11:34, Ps 51:13; [[לֽקֵחַ אֶת־]] ´[[י]] [[אֲדׂנֶי ְמֵעַל ראׁשְֶָׁ]] is about to take away thy lord from over thy head, so v:Ps 51:5; cf. abs. [[אֵינֶנּוּ]] [[אׂתוֹ אלהים]] ´[[כִּי־ל]] Ge 5:24 (P); more oft. without [[מִן]], Ge 27:36, Ge 27:36, Ge 30:15, Ge 30:15, Ge 31:1 (all J), Ju Jdg 11:13, Jdg 11:15, Jdg 15:6, Jdg 18:24, 1Sa 12:3, 1Sa 12:3, 2Sa 12:4, 1Ki 11:34, Job 12:20; abs. Job 1:21; [[אֶתֶּן־לְ ְמֶלֶח בְּאַפִּי וְאֶקַּח בְּעֶבְרָתִי]] Ho 13:11; of the sword, taking away its victims Ez Eze 33:4, Eze 33:6; fig. of taking away understanding Ho 4:11.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: esp. take away life 1Ki 19:10, 1Ki 19:14, Ps 31:14, Pr 1:19, Jon 4:3.
take to or for a person:

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: for oneself, sq. acc. + [[לְ]], = appropriate to oneself De 7:25, Nu 8:16 (P), De 22:7, 2Ki 12:6; c. [[לְ]] as dat. comm., Zec 11:7; [[אֶת־שְׁנֵי יְלָדַי לוֹ לַעֲבָדִים]] ´[[ל]] 2Ki 4:1 to take my two sons for himself for slaves; so (without [[לְ]] reflex.), [[תִּקָּחֶנּוּ לְעֶבֶד עוֹלָם]] Job 40:28 wilt thou take him as slave for ever?

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: = procure, get, sq. acc. + [[לְ]], [[קְחוּ לָכֶם תֶּבֶן]]Ex 5:11 (J) get you straw; [[לֽקֵחַ לוֹ קָלוֹן]] Pr 9:7 getteth to himself shame; so oft., esp. [[קַח לְְ]], etc., Ge 6:21, Ge 12:19, Ge 16:21, Ge 45:19 +; without [[לְ]], Ne 5:2 let us procure corn, and eat and live; of acquiring a field Pr 31:16.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: take possession of, sq. acc., of land De 29:7, Jos 11:16, Jos 11:23 (all D), 2Ch 16:5; cf. [[פְּקֻדָּתוֹ יִקַּח אַחֵר]] Ps 109:8 his office let another take; fig. [[הַלַּיְלָה הַהוּא יִקָּחֵהוּ אׂפֶל]] Job 3:6 that night—let darkness take possession of it!

definitions.title: e.
definitions.body: esp. take in marriage: (I) for another, esp. a son, c. [[לְ]], [[וְלָקַחְתָּ֫ אִשָּׁה לִבְנִי]], Ge 24:4 and thou shalt take a wife for my son, so v:Ge 24:7, v:Ge 24:38, v:Ge 24:40, v:Ge 24:48 (all J), Ge 21:21 (E), Je 29:6; (2) more oft. for oneself, usu. c. [[לְ]] reflex. (sts. + [[לְאִשָּׁה]]), Ge 4:19, Ge 6:2, Ge 11:29, Ge 12:19 (all J), +oft.; without [[לְ]] Ge 20:2, Ge 20:3 (E), etc.

definitions.title: f.
definitions.body: = receive, accept, esp. a bribe, gift, ransom, etc., 1Sa 8:3, 1Sa 12:3 c, 1Sa 12:4 (both sq. [[מִן]]), Am 5:12, 2Ki 5:15, 2Ki 5:16, 2Ki 5:20, 2Ki 5:23, 2Ki 5:26, 2Ki 5:26, Ps 15:5; interest-money Ez Eze 18:13, Eze 18:17, Eze 22:12; inheritance Jos 13:8, Jos 18:7(both D), Nu 34:14, Nu 34:14, Nu 34:15 (P); of earth, receiving Abel's blood Ge 4:11(J); chastisement Is 40:2; of perceiving a sound, Job 4:11 mine ear received a whisper of it; receive mentally: [[וְלָקַח]] [[בְּעָלָיו]] Ex 22:10 (E) i.e. shall accept the oath as satisfactory; [[בָּרֵח לָקַחְתִּי]] Nu 23:20 (JE), i.e. I have received (commandment by revelation) to bless; receive instruction Pr 24:32, Je 2:30 +; entanglements of temptation Pr 22:25.

definitions.title: g.
definitions.body: take, as preliminary to further action: Ge 31:34(E), she took them and put them; Ju Jdg 3:25 take key and open ; Jos 2:4 she took the two men and hid them; 1Ki 18:4 Obadiah took 100 prophets and hid them; 1Ki 19:21 Elisha took the yoke of oxen and slew them, cf. 2Sa 17:19, 2Sa 18:18; sts. wholly redundant, [[קְחוּ וַעֲשׂוּ עֲגָלָה חֲדָשָׁה]] 1Sa 6:7 take and prepare a new cart, etc.; somewhat different is [[הַלּֽקְחִים לְשׁוֹנׇם וַיִּנְאֲמוּ נְאֻם]] Je 23:31, i.e. they take (= make use of) their own tongues, and talk oracles.

take up, upon =put upon, sq. [[עַל]]: [[וַתִּקַּת תָּמָר אֵפֶר עַל־ראׁשָׁהּ]] 2Sa 13:19 and Tamar put ashes upon her head; [[וַיִּקָּחֶהָ עַל־הַחֲמוֹר]] Ju Jdg 19:28; cf. [[יִפְרשׁׂ כְּנׇפָיו יִקָּחֵהוּ]] De 32:11 he spreadeth his wings, he taketh him up.

= fetch: [[קְחִי־נׇא]] [[לִי מְעַט־מַיִם]] 1Ki 17:10 fetch me, pray, a little water, cf. v:1Ki 17:11, v:1Ki 17:11, 2Ki 2:20, 2Ki 4:41; [[וְקַח־לִי מִשָּׁם שְׁנֵי גְּדָיֵי]] [[עִוִּים]] Ge 27:9 and fetch me thence two kids, cf. v:Ge 27:13 (J); + [[בְּיָדִי]] 1Sa 21:9; an offering Le 12:8 (P; ‖[[הֵבִיא]] v:Le 12:6); c. human obj. oft. nearly = summon, [[לָקׂב]] [[אׂיְבַי לְקַחְתִּיְ]] Nu 33:11 (JE) to curse mine enemies did I summon thee, Ju Jdg 11:5, 1Sa 16:11; [[שְׁלַח וְקַח]] [[אׂתוֹ אֵלַי]] 1Sa 20:31 send and bring him unto me; 2Ki 3:15, 2Ki 6:13 +; of ´[[י]], summoning his people from exile, [[מִשָּׁם יְקָּחְֶָ]] De 30:4.

take=lead, conduct (with or without contact): [[וַיִּקַּח אֶת־שְׁנֵי]] [[בָנׇיו עִמּוֹ]] Ge 48:1; [[גַּם בְּקַרְכֶם קְחוּ]] Ex 12:32 (both E); [[וְאֶת־עַמּוֹ לָקַח עִמּוֹ]] Ex 14:6 (J) and his people he took with him; cf. v:Ex 14:7 (J), Jos 8:1 (JE), Ju Jdg 4:6; [[אֶקָּֽחֲ ְאֶל־מָקוֹם אַחֵר]] Nu 23:27 I will take thee unto another place, cf. v:Nu 23:14, v:Nu 23:28 (all JE); ´[[י]] subj., [[וׇאֶקַּח]] [[אֶת־אֲבִיכֶם]] Jos 24:3 (E) and I took your father Abraham from beyond the river; [[לַמָּוֶת הַצֵּל לְקֻחִים]] rescue those led to death.

take = capture, seize: [[לָקַחְתִּי בְחָזְקָה]] 1Sa 2:16 I will take by force, sc. flesh ; of spoils, ´[[לאׁ ל]] [[בֶּחַע כֶּסֶף]] Ju Jdg 5:19 gain of silver they took not; of capture of ark 1Sa 5:1; bronze 2Sa 8:3, etc.; territory Ge 48:22 (E), De 3:14; cities Nu 21:25 (JE),.De 3:14, Jos 11:19 (D), 1Sa 7:14, 2Sa 8:1; of capture of hippopotamus Job 40:24; of seductions of woman, [[וְאַל־תִּקָּֽחֲ ְבְּעַפְעַפֶּיהָ]] Pr 6:25 and let her not capture thee with her eyelids.
take = carry off:
in phr. take vengeance: [[וְנִקְחָה נִקְמָתֵנוּ מִמֶּנּוּ]] Je 20:10 and we will take our vengeance upon him; abs. [[נׇקָם אֶקַּח]] Is 47:3 vengeance will I take.
be captured, of ark 1Sa 4:11, 1Sa 4:17, 1Sa 4:19, 1Sa 4:21, 1Sa 4:22.
be taken away, removed, of shewbread 1Sa 21:7 ; of removal by death Ez Eze 33:6 ; of translation of Elijah 2Ki 2:9 (c. [[מֵעִם]] pers.)
be taken, brought unto ([[אֶל־]]), only Es 2:8, Es 2:16.

be taken from, out of ( [[מִן]] of source ) Ge 2:23, Ge 3:19, Ge 3:23 (all J); cf. [[וְלֻקַּח מֵהֶם]] [[קְלָלָה]] Je 29:22 and there shall be taken from them ( derived from their case ) a curse-formula.
= be stolen from, Ju Jdg 17:2 ( [[ל]] pers.)
be taken captive, Je 48:46, cf. Is 52:5.
be taken away, removed ( =

definitions.title: Niph. 2
definitions.body: ), of Elijah's translation 2Ki 2:10 (c. [[מֵאֵת]] pers.), of death Is 53:8 (c. [[מִן]], prob. instr.)
be taken, brought unto Ge 12:15 (J; sq. [[בֵּית]] to the house of), Ge 18:4 (abs.)
be taken out of Job 28:2 ([[מִן]] of source ), from, of Ez Eze 15:3 ([[מִן]] partit.)
be taken away from Is 49:24 ([[מִן]] pers.); abs. v:Is 49:25.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Pt. fs. [[אֵשׁ מִתְלַקַּ֫חַת]] lit. fire taking hold of itself, of lightning Ex 9:24 (JE), Ez Eze 1:4, exact signif. dub.; in close succession, incessant Di Sm, infolding itself, i.e. a mass of fire, Thes RobGes A VVB SS, > of quivering flashes Buhl, of forked or zigzag lightning Da.
